ygData.messageBody:
Greetings, Scaled One . . . <br><br>Funny you
should ask -- I've just started a character on SZ. But
I'm pretty much the opposite of you; I started a Good
(Human) Cleric. I suspect we'd have to try to hurt each
other if we met in-game (although I'd certainly offer a
truce to anyone from this club!). <br><br>But, yes, it
is much different. I haven't gotten to the
PvP-capable level yet, but that doesn't stop people from
trying.<br><br>As far as I've heard, for melees in PvP it's all
about getting Magic Resistance equipment. If you can
withstand a spell, you have a much better chance of getting
in close. Range weapons will help, if you can time
it to interrupt casting, too. But the big drawback
is that you don't have any form of Snare or Root,
which is what most PvP's start off with,
evidently.<br><br>But I applaud you for trying something hard. I've
been told that Clerics are kind of useless for PvP,
since they have very little in the way of non-magical
offensive skills (see the MR note above). Their biggest
advantage is that they're hard to kill, because of their
healing abilities. Many times, folks just give up, as the
Cleric stands there and heals himself.<br><br>I intend
to be a necromancer-hunter. I figure that my
anti-undead spells would be good for that. We'll
see.<br><br>Leofric, Kharlisht's alter-ego on Sullon Zek
